intro: Anisocycla capituliflora, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive, irregularly shaped head. Anisocycla capituliflora is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
